page.title: 01THE AREA OF AUDLEY HALMEREND
page.content: The area covered by our grid squares is mostly in the Parish of Audley.The area to the extreme west is either in the parish of Betley or Barthomley. The area is mainly rural with most of the block covered by grassland for pasture/cutting or crops.Originally, some of the villages in the area were important mining communities but many pits have now closed.However,open cast mining is now growing in importance and there are plans for further areas in the near future.Although this means more jobs most people now work in nearby Stoke,Crewe or Newcastle. Two villages are found in the area; Halmerend an old mining village and Audley the main shopping centre for the parish.In 1860,the area was described as "an out of the way,quiet place" - to some extent it has not changed!
